resources.string: LearningContract
Learning Contract
Zairen V. Lapid
Contract
CC17- MOBILE APPLICATION DESIGN AND DEVELOPMENT
Expectations
⦁ We expect to learn how to design and build functional and user-friendly mobile applications using Android Studio.
⦁ We expect to improve our skills in writing clean, efficient code for mobile platforms.
⦁ We expect to understand the entire process of mobile app development, from planning and UI design to testing and deployment.
⦁ We expect to collaborate as a team and divide tasks fairly so that everyone contributes to the project.
⦁ We expect to receive guidance and feedback from our instructor to help us refine our app ideas and improve our work.
Motivations
⦁ We are motivated by the opportunity to create a working mobile app that we can be proud of.
⦁ We want to gain experience that will prepare us for real-world mobile development jobs or internships.
⦁ We are excited to learn Android Studio and explore what we can build with it.
⦁ We are motivated by the challenge of solving real problems through mobile technology.
⦁ We want to build a project that could potentially be included in our portfolios or even be used by real users.
Contributions
⦁ We will attend our classes be it synchronous or Face-to-Face as punctually as we can.
⦁ We will submit every deliverable on time and with quality output to the best of our knowledge and ability.
⦁ We guarantee our integrity and honesty with each and every single one of our activities.
⦁ We will give both our professor and fellow students and peers the respect that they deserve in each interaction.
⦁ We will study each module and answer questions during F2F discussions in recitations.
Hindrances
⦁ We might face challenges when debugging errors that are hard to track down in Android Studio.
⦁ We may encounter scheduling conflicts that make it hard to meet regularly as a group.
⦁ We could have difficulty managing time when several deliverables are due at the same time.
⦁ We may struggle with remembering concepts like APIs, databases, or UI/UX best practices at first.
⦁ Technical issues like slow laptops/desktops or emulator problems could delay our development process.
signature
